Metaphor:CHANGE OF STATE IS CHANGE OF LOCATION

From EN MetaNet Wiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Name Gloss CHANGE OF STATE IS CHANGE OF LOCATION
Name Transcription
Aliases

CHANGE OF STATE IS CHANGE OF LOCATION

CHANGES ARE MOVEMENTS (Philosophy in the Flesh,179)

CHANGE IS MOTION

Description
Comments Cultural scope checked for Persian--Aria
Tags
Family Location Event Structure Metaphor, States are Locations metaphors, Grady Primary Metaphors
Metaphor Level
Metaphor Type
Experiential Basis
Cultural Scope Persian, American English
Source Frame Motion along a path
Roles:speed, direction, mover, motion_x-schema, source, path, goal, pathway, landmark
Target Frame Change of state
Roles:experiencer, initial_state, transition, final_state, state_change_process, standard, state


Mappings:

experiencer <= mover
standard <= landmark
initial_state <= source
transition <= path
final_state <= goal
state_change_process <= motion_x-schema

Related Metaphors:

Current Metaphor CHANGE OF STATE IS CHANGE OF LOCATION
Relation Type is both a source and target subcase of
Related Metaphor EXPERIENCING A STATE IS BEING AT A LOCATION
Description

Entailments:

Target Entailment starting to experience a state
Source Inference moving into a bounded region (goal)
Type of Inferential Structure x-schema stage
Entailed Metaphor(s)
Target Entailment no longer experiencing a state
Source Inference moving out of a bounded region (source)
Type of Inferential Structure x-schema stage
Entailed Metaphor(s)
Target Entailment transition to a state
Source Inference moving across the boundary of a bounded region
Type of Inferential Structure x-schema stage
Entailed Metaphor(s)
Target Entailment state change can be caused by an external entity
Source Inference location can be changed by external entity applying force
Type of Inferential Structure external causation
Entailed Metaphor(s) CAUSED CHANGE OF STATE IS CAUSED CHANGE OF LOCATION
Target Entailment Prevented change of state
Source Inference Prevented change of location
Type of Inferential Structure external causation
Entailed Metaphor(s) PREVENTED CHANGE OF STATE IS PREVENTED CHANGE OF LOCATION
Target Entailment state can be changed by 'self'/experiencer
Source Inference location can be changed by 'self'/trajector (e.g. self-propelled motion)
Type of Inferential Structure internal causation
Entailed Metaphor(s) SELF-INITIATED STATE CHANGE IS SELF-PROPELLED MOTION

Examples:

Example Text: He went crazy.

Facts about "CHANGE OF STATE IS CHANGE OF LOCATION"RDF feed
Entailmentstarting to experience a state (moving into a bounded region (goal), x-schema stage, ?) +, no longer experiencing a state (moving out of a bounded region (source), x-schema stage, ?) +, transition to a state (moving across the boundary of a bounded region, x-schema stage, ?) +, state change can be caused by an external entity (location can be changed by external entity applying force, external causation, CAUSED CHANGE OF STATE IS CAUSED CHANGE OF LOCATION) +, Prevented change of state (Prevented change of location, external causation, PREVENTED CHANGE OF STATE IS PREVENTED CHANGE OF LOCATION) + and state can be changed by 'self'/experiencer (location can be changed by 'self'/trajector (e.g. self-propelled motion), internal causation, SELF-INITIATED STATE CHANGE IS SELF-PROPELLED MOTION) +
Entered byEllen +
ExampleEnglish (He went crazy., ?, ?, PITF, p. 183, ?, ?, ?) +, English (He fell into a depression., ?, ?, PITF, p. 183, ?, state is bounded region, ?) +, English (I came out of my depression., ?, ?, PITF, p. 183, ?, state is bounded region, ?) +, English (He went over the edge., ?, ?, PITF, p. 183, ?, state is bounded region, ?) + and English (Things have gone from bad to worse lately., ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) +
